items.message: The flood alert for the River Wandle is no longer in force. River levels peaked overnight and are expected to continue to fall throughout today 14/06/25. The risk of flooding has now passed. The forecast is for showers over the next few days. We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.eaAreaName: Cumbria and Lancashire
items.message:
Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible, property flooding is not expected.
The flood alert level is forecast to be reached at 13:00 today, Saturday 14th July.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around The Upper Derwent from Seathwaite to Derwent Water.
Following heavy thundery showers overnight, river levels are high and further showers are forecast throughout the day but no further flooding is expected. 
We are closely monitoring the situation 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 15/06/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Solent and South Downs

floodArea.riverOrSea: Polegate Brook Street Stream, Wannock Mill Stream

items.message: Less than 9mm of rain was recorded at our rain gauges Friday evening. River levels only rose a small amount. Isolated, light showers might still occur at times on Saturday and Sunday. However, as forecast rainfall amounts over the weekend are now minimal, river flooding is no longer thought possible. High pressure is predicted to bring settled weather next week. If you see a blockage affecting the flow in the river, please call our incident hotline on 0800 80 70 60. We will re-issue this Flood Alert if the risk of property flooding returns.

items.eaAreaName: Solent and South Downs
items.message: Less than 6mm of rain was recorded at our rain gauges Friday evening. River levels only rose a small amount. Isolated, light showers might still occur at times on Saturday and Sunday. However, as forecast rainfall amounts over the weekend are now minimal, river flooding is no longer thought possible. High pressure is predicted to bring settled weather next week. If you see a blockage affecting the flow in the river, please call our incident hotline on 0800 80 70 60. We will re-issue this Flood Alert if the risk of property flooding returns.
